name: 007_entrance_wrong_use_of_verbs
description: test using a lot of verbs the wrong way
expected_full_outputs:
Available verbs include: attack, climb, close, drink, drop, eat, enter, examine, exit, give, go, help, jump, lock, open, pull, push, put, read, show, stand, stow, take, unlock, wear

(with your Fist)

What kind of deranged person attacks a Front Gate with a Fist?!?

(choosing the 'up' direction in which to climb)

You can't climb the Front Gate.

The Big Rock cannot be closed.

I don't see the word 'from' in that sentence.

Your attempts to quaff the Front Gate do not meet with success.

You don't possess the Big Rock.

You don't possess the Moat.

You don't possess the Burt.

You don't possess the Big Rock.

You can't use the 'enter' command on the Moat.

You can't use the 'enter' command on the Tree.

You can't use the 'enter' command on the Front Gate.

Despite twisting yourself into a pretzel you still can't manage to enter the Big Rock.

*** Entrance ***

You stand upon the ancient drawbridge at the entrance of Dark Castle. The murky waters of the moat swirl beneath your feet and, before you, barring your way, is the ominous front gate.

Behind you, just beyond the drawbridge, is an extremely old and rusty postbox besides which stands a large tree with some low branches. Across the way from the postbox is a big rock covered in moss and lichen. 

There is a Front Gate to the north, a climb leading up, an Untrodden Path to the southwest, a leap down to the moat to the east, and a leap down to the moat to the west.

Well, the Untrodden Path is a bit misnamed to be honest - because you just trod upon it to get here - but it's certainly not trod on much. It's a narrow, winding trail that leads back down the hill and through the woods to the village in the valley below. It is overgrown with weeds and brambles - not a lot of folks dare to make the journey through grimwood forest and up knife ridge any more - but here you are, Burt!

I don't see a Trail here.

I don't see a Brambles here.

Available verbs include: attack, climb, close, drink, drop, eat, enter, examine, exit, give, go, help, jump, lock, open, pull, push, put, read, show, stand, stow, take, unlock, wear

You can't use the 'exit' command on the Postbox.

You can't use the 'exit' command on the Moat.

You can't go that way.

'rock' is not a valid direction that you can go in.

Help syntax = 'help <option>'. Help options = 'basics', 'abbreviations', 'adjectives', 'articles', 'attack', 'creatures', 'command-queue', debug', 'inventory', 'multiples', 'one-word-commands', prepositions', 'read', 'save', 'travel', or 'verbs'.

*** Up Tree ***

You are perched in a large tree about ten feet above the ground. The nearest branch above you is above your reach. From your vantage point, Dark Castle looms as darkly as ever and the moat looks even more vile and unappealing than it does from the drawbridge. Still, the tree's wide branches are grand and calming.

Just above you - where the next branch should be - is a tree hollow. By standing on your tippy-toes on your current branch, you could just peek into it. 

There is a climb leading down.

On the ground below you can see: a Postbox. 

in a feat of unaccustomed agility, you manage to land on your feet without killing yourself.

*** Entrance ***

You stand upon the ancient drawbridge at the entrance of Dark Castle. The murky waters of the moat swirl beneath your feet and, before you, barring your way, is the ominous front gate.

Behind you, just beyond the drawbridge, is an extremely old and rusty postbox besides which stands a large tree with some low branches. Across the way from the postbox is a big rock covered in moss and lichen. 

There is a Front Gate to the north, a climb leading up, an Untrodden Path to the southwest, a leap down to the moat to the east, and a leap down to the moat to the west.

Available verbs include: attack, climb, close, drink, drop, eat, enter, examine, exit, give, go, help, jump, lock, open, pull, push, put, read, show, stand, stow, take, unlock, wear

I don't see the word 'with' in that sentence.

I don't see a Jump here.

The Big Rock cannot be locked.

The Moat cannot be openned.

The Front Gate is locked.

Pulling on the Front Gate has no effect.

Pulling on the Big Rock has no effect.

Pushing on the Front Gate has no effect.

Pushing on the Big Rock has no effect.

Pushing on the Tree has no effect.

You can't put the Cheese Wedge in or on the Big Rock.

Available verbs include: attack, climb, close, drink, drop, eat, enter, examine, exit, give, go, help, jump, lock, open, pull, push, put, read, show, stand, stow, take, unlock, wear

The Cheese Wedge has nothing written on it.

I don't see a Biscuit here.

Openned. The Paper Bag contains: a Baked Biscuit. 

On the Baked Biscuit, written in Insignia, you read: Baked into the biscuit are the symbols of a key and sword. As a child you remember asking your great grandmother Nana why she stamped these onto the front of every biscuit. 'It's a reminder of the past Burty,', she declared, 'and maybe someday, even, of the future.' You were never clear what she meant - but you've loyaly used Nana's original key and sword stamp on every biscuit you've ever baked..

Exactly how would you expect the Moat to respond to the Paper Bag?

You're already standing in the Entrance!

Taken

Stowed

The Rusty Key is already in your backpack!

You're not holding the Big Rock in your hand.

You're not holding the Moat in your hand.

You don't have enough capacity to take the Big Rock along with everything else you are carrying.

Just how do you intend to pick up a Postbox?

Just how do you intend to pick up a Tree?

Just how do you intend to pick up a Moat?

I don't see the word 'with' in that sentence.

You're not holding the Big Rock in your hand.

You attempt to unlock the Front Gate with the Cheese Wedge without success.

The Tree cannot be unlocked.

Available verbs include: attack, climb, close, drink, drop, eat, enter, examine, exit, give, go, help, jump, lock, open, pull, push, put, read, show, stand, stow, take, unlock, wear

You don't possess the Tree.

With a keen eye for high fashion, you boldly attempt to accoutre yourself in the Paper Bag... it doesn't really work out... but nothing is harmed... except maybe your ego...
